Board of Education of the City of New York
Bureau of Radio and Television
29 Fort Greene Place
Brooklyn, 17, N.Y.
May 15, 1964.
MEMORANDUM
FROM: Lou Kleinman
TO: NYSERTA Members
RE: New York State Audio-Visual Council Meeting
The 1964 Annual Winter Meeting of the New York State
Audio-Visual Council will be held in New York City from
Sunday through Wednesday, November 22-25, 1964. Two of these
days will be devoted to special presentations of interest to
educators at all levels of instruction. The sessions will
run from thirty to forty minutes.
1 As the NYSERTA representative on the Program Comm¬
ittee for this meeting, I am inviting you to submit for con¬
sideration a presentation of the activities of your radio
and/or television stations which would be of interest to
the entire state. Those that seem of greatest import and
concern will be selected, and you will be given more inform¬
ation in July.
Steve Feit of the Valley Stream school system is a
co-chairman of the Program Committee, and he is in charge of
the preparation of the tentative program for the meeting.
Please let him know at your earliest convenience if you will,
be able to participate. A form for your response is provided-
at the bottom of this letter. Thank you for your cooperation.
Cordially,
Lou Kleinman
Mr. Stephen Feit
District 30 Schools
Valley Stream, N.Y.
I shall be happy to submit for consideration a presentation
to the N.Y.S.A.V.C. for its meeting in November. My topic
